rows.title: Notice how you feel

transcript.eng:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!

rows.transcript:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!

text_1.eng: Take a moment to check in with yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!

rows.text_1: Take a moment to check in with yourself.

section_1_text.eng:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.

rows.section_1_text:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today’s topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Teens go through many changes in their bodies and feelings. Talking to them helps them handle it better.

Let your teen know you’re there to listen and support them. You don’t need all the answers—just being there helps them feel safe and make good choices.

text_2.eng:
**Think back to your own teenage years:**

- Did you face any challenges with body changes or relationships?
- What support or advice do you wish you had?
- Do you think your teen might be going through something similar?

media_title.eng: Why talk with your teen about body changes and relationships? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Discussing body and intimate relationships with your child can be difficult. However, it is important to have these discussions in order for your teen to understand that this stage of life is normal. This will help them to acknowledge the changes in their bodies and be able to make positive decisions regarding intimate relationships.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today’s topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Teens go through many changes in their bodies and feelings. Talking to them helps them handle it better.

Let your teen know you’re there to listen and support them. You don’t need all the answers—just being there helps them feel safe and make good choices.
rows.text_2:
**Think back to your own teenage years:**

- What support or advice do you wish you had?
- Do you think your teen might be going through something similar?
rows.media_title: Why talk with your teen about body changes and relationships? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Discussing body and intimate relationships with your child can be difficult. However, it is important to have these discussions in order for your teen to understand that this stage of life is normal. This will help them to acknowledge the changes in their bodies and be able to make positive decisions regarding intimate relationships.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Even if these conversations feel uncomfortable at first, starting small can build trust. You might be surprised by how much your teen wants to share once they know you are ready to listen without judgment.

media_title.eng: Hear how @global.app_name helped @data.characters.media_female_10.name talk to her son about relationships

media_transcript.eng:
Thanks to the app, I can now talk to my son about all these changes that he is going through with his body and emotions and relationships. We were both not comfortable bringing it up before, but the practical examples in the app made it possible for us to start talking. And I was really surprised by how many questions and experiences my son already has, even though he is only 14!

Now he can come to me if there is something happening at school or if he is not sure how to handle something. The other day he even told me that some of his friends were making fun of him because he does not have a girlfriend yet, so we talked about it and I could explain to him that it is important to focus on school first and that it is never okay for someone to pressure him to have a relationship.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Even if these conversations feel uncomfortable at first, starting small can build trust. You might be surprised by how much your teen wants to share once they know you are ready to listen without judgment.
rows.media_title: Hear how @global.app_name helped @data.characters.media_female_10.name talk to her son about relationships
rows.media_transcript:
Thanks to the app, I can now talk to my son about all these changes that he is going through with his body and emotions and relationships. We were both not comfortable bringing it up before, but the practical examples in the app made it possible for us to start talking. And I was really surprised by how many questions and experiences my son already has, even though he is only 14!

Now he can come to me if there is something happening at school or if he is not sure how to handle something. The other day he even told me that some of his friends were making fun of him because he does not have a girlfriend yet, so we talked about it and I could explain to him that it is important to focus on school first and that it is never okay for someone to pressure him to have a relationship.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Teens often learn different things about sex from school, friends, family, or social media - but this information isn’t always correct or right for their age.

Talking about sex can feel uncomfortable. Parents and teens may even argue, especially if parents don’t agree with what their teen is doing.

Let’s see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, handled this.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is on her way to leave the house looking very pretty.

character_1_text.eng: Where are you going looking like that?

character_2_text.eng: I am going out with some of my friends.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Teens often learn different things about sex from school, friends, family, or social media - but this information isn’t always correct or right for their age.

Talking about sex can feel uncomfortable. Parents and teens may even argue, especially if parents don’t agree with what their teen is doing.

Let’s see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, handled this.
rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is on her way to leave the house looking very pretty.
rows.character_1_text: Where are you going looking like that?
rows.character_2_text: I am going out with some of my friends.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name accidentally drops her bag, and a packet of condoms falls out.

character_1_text.eng: What is that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Condoms? Why are you carrying those in your bag? Where did you get them?!

character_2_text.eng: I got it from one of the girls at school today. We were talking about safe sex and she said she uses birth control so that she does not get pregnant.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name accidentally drops her bag, and a packet of condoms falls out.
rows.character_1_text: What is that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Condoms? Why are you carrying those in your bag? Where did you get them?!
rows.character_2_text: I got it from one of the girls at school today. We were talking about safe sex and she said she uses birth control so that she does not get pregnant.

character_1_text.eng: What is this talk of sex in my house! You are too young…

rows.character_1_text: What is this talk of sex in my house! You are too young…

character_1_text.eng: No, no, no, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name! I will not have this discussion with you. Is that what you do at school? Talking about things not suited for your age instead of focusing on school? You won’t go out with those friends of yours anymore. You want to bring shame in this home. Come here now! I am going to hit you. Stupid girl!

character_2_text.eng: No @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, please don’t hit me, it is not what you think!

rows.character_1_text: No, no, no, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name! I will not have this discussion with you. Is that what you do at school? Talking about things not suited for your age instead of focusing on school? You won’t go out with those friends of yours anymore. You want to bring shame in this home. Come here now! I am going to hit you. Stupid girl!
rows.character_2_text: No @data.characters.f2_grandmother.role_name, please don’t hit me, it is not what you think!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_question.eng: Why do you think @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name reacted the way she did?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: She was shocked that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name had condoms

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
It is possible she felt this way and then reacted harshly.

When we are angry or scared, we can say or do things that hurt others and harm our relationships.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: She felt disrespected and angry at @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
It is possible she felt this way and then reacted harshly.

When we are angry or scared, we can say or do things that hurt others and harm our relationships.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: She was scared that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name was already having sex

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
It is possible she felt this way and then reacted harshly.

When we are angry or scared, we can say or do things that hurt others and harm our relationships.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: She felt ashamed to talk about sex

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
It is possible she felt this way and then reacted harshly.

When we are angry or scared, we can say or do things that hurt others and harm our relationships.

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name may not trust @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name in the future

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, all of these are true. After this fight, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name may look for answers somewhere else.
She might end up in unsafe situations and not feel okay talking to @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name about it even if she has questions or needs help. She may feel worried that @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name will judge her choices or feel ashamed of her.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name may not ask @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name questions or advice if she has a problem

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name may make bad decisions out of anger

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We saw how challenging that moment was for @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name.

Talking about boyfriends and girlfriends is not always easy - for parents or teens.

Let’s look at an example of how this kind of conversation can happen calmly.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name, can I talk to you about something?

character_2_text.eng: (_calmly_) Sure, my darling. What is the matter?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We saw how challenging that moment was for @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name.

Talking about boyfriends and girlfriends is not always easy - for parents or teens.

Let’s look at an example of how this kind of conversation can happen calmly.
rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name, can I talk to you about something?
rows.character_2_text: (_calmly_) Sure, my darling. What is the matter?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name wants us to study together tomorrow. I really like him but I am not sure what to do.

character_2_text.eng: (🤔_thinking to herself_) How has my daughter grown up so fast? What now? Take a deep breath…

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name wants us to study together tomorrow. I really like him but I am not sure what to do.
rows.character_2_text: (🤔_thinking to herself_) How has my daughter grown up so fast? What now? Take a deep breath…

character_1_text.eng:
(_calmly_) Thank you for sharing this with me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I know that you like @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name a lot, he is a charming boy and he does great at school, but you are only 16 and he is 18.

I feel worried that it is not safe for you to be alone with him. He might pressure you into doing something that you are not prepared to do.

I don’t want to tell you who you can see but we need to have some rules about how you spend time together.

rows.character_1_text:
(_calmly_) Thank you for sharing this with me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I know that you like @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name a lot, he is a charming boy and he does great at school, but you are only 16 and he is 18.

I feel worried that it is not safe for you to be alone with him. He might pressure you into doing something that you are not prepared to do.

I don’t want to tell you who you can see but we need to have some rules about how you spend time together.

character_1_text.eng: What do you think would be a fair rule about how you spend time together?

character_2_text.eng: How about, we can spend time together if there is an adult with us?

rows.character_1_text: What do you think would be a fair rule about how you spend time together?
rows.character_2_text: How about, we can spend time together if there is an adult with us?

character_1_text.eng: That would be fine as long as his parents also know. I will chat with his mother when I see her later today. And after you get back, we can talk about how it went.

character_2_text.eng: _(hugs @data.characters.f1_mother.name)_ Okay. Thank you for coming up with a plan together, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.

rows.character_1_text: That would be fine as long as his parents also know. I will chat with his mother when I see her later today. And after you get back, we can talk about how it went.
rows.character_2_text: _(hugs @data.characters.f1_mother.name)_ Okay. Thank you for coming up with a plan together, @data.characters.f1_mother.role_name.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, it was hard for both @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and @data.characters.f1_mother.name to start this conversation.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, it was probably hard to start this conversation, but they were hoping to find a good way forward together.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f1_mother.name uses all these great strategies!

quiz_3_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name feel after their conversation?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng: When we stay calm, share how we feel, and look for solutions together, it will help us all – even if we are not sure of the right outcome. You can learn to manage tricky situations and problems together with your teen.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name did well by finding solutions together with @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. But this can be hard to do.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.

text_2.eng: Here are some questions from other parents to help you begin.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships? 
Try selecting each option for more tips!

rows.quiz_1_question:
Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships? 
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.text_1_facilitator:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name did well by finding solutions together with @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. But this can be hard to do.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.
rows.text_2: Here are some questions from other parents to help you begin.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This is not quite right. 

Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This is not quite right. 

Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This is not quite right. 

Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This is not quite right. 

Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it’s okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it’s also okay not to know everything. You can say, “I’m not sure - let me find out and tell you later.”

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it’s okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it’s also okay not to know everything. You can say, “I’m not sure - let me find out and tell you later.”

quiz_1_question.eng:
When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend

rows.quiz_1_question:
When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It’s good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child’s questions.

You don’t need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It’s good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child’s questions.

You don’t need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.

quiz_1_question.eng:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: I determine what my teen can and cannot do

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: I keep information or bad influences away from them

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: I emphasize that pressure is never okay

rows.quiz_1_question:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: I determine what my teen can and cannot do
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: I keep information or bad influences away from them
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: I emphasize that pressure is never okay

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can’t control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong—and help them feel confident to make good decisions.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can’t control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong—and help them feel confident to make good decisions.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there’s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences—and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there’s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences—and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones..

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something they’re not okay with. You can learn more about this in the Staying Safe module.

rows.text_1_facilitator:

quiz_1_question.eng:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Keep any information about sex away from them

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex

rows.quiz_1_question:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: Keep any information about sex away from them
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex—from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn’t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex—from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn’t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems—and this can lead to risky situations.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems—and this can lead to risky situations.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That’s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they’re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That’s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they’re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Discussing body changes and intimate relationships can be uncomfortable, but it is so important in order to keep your teen happy, healthy and safe. 

Here are some skills to help you get started.

section_1_text.eng:
Build a strong relationship with your teen by spending time with them and showing them you trust them. Create a safe, encouraging space, and avoid judging them.

That will make your teen share their questions and worries with you, when they need advice or are in a potentially dangerous situation.

section_2_text.eng:
Your teen may feel shy or scared, so parents need to start the talk about body changes and intimate relationships.

Begin early by answering questions simply and honestly. This builds confidence for you and your child.

It’s okay to feel uncomfortable. Be open, use the correct words, and get help if you don’t know all the answers.

section_3_text.eng:
Your teen will hear about sex from many places. If they feel safe with you, you can help them find good information and make smart choices.

Help them think about consequences without shame or blame. Make sure they know they should never feel pressure (or pressure others) into sex or a relationship.

You can also ask other adults or health workers for help and information.

rows.section_1_text:

That will make your teen share their questions and worries with you, when they need advice or are in a potentially dangerous situation.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week’s home activity is to read and talk about this module’s stories with your teen. Use them to start a conversation about body changes and relationships.

You can talk about what happened with @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and their parents.

These stories can make it easier to talk about tricky topics and share ideas about healthy, respectful relationships.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you read the stories with your teen and use them to start an open talk about body changes and relationships?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Perfect! Talking about these topics openly helps your teen feel safe, supported, and able to make healthy decisions.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You are doing so well! Even starting a small conversation makes a big difference. Keep going - your teen will appreciate your support.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. It is normal for these talks to feel a little uncomfortable at first. Try again another time - every small step counts.

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you read the stories with your teen and use them to start an open talk about body changes and relationships?
rows.text_1_facilitator:
This week’s home activity is to read and talk about this module’s stories with your teen. Use them to start a conversation about body changes and relationships.

You can talk about what happened with @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and their parents.

These stories can make it easier to talk about tricky topics and share ideas about healthy, respectful relationships.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Talking openly with your teen about body changes and relationships helps them feel safe, supported, and better able to make healthy choices. 

No matter your teen’s age, now is the best time to build trust and guide them with care.

media_title.eng: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name learned a lot from honest talks with her mother. Tap play to hear their story

media_transcript.eng:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. I thought all those things were true, and I was doing a lot of things secretly, because my friends were pushing me and I was afraid of what my mother would say.

When I did this app together with my mother, I realised that so many things I learnt were not true. I learnt I can get better information and I learnt others should never push me to do things I do not want to do. My mother and I can talk about these things now. I wish we could have done that when I was younger, because it would have helped me a lot, but I am still glad we can talk today. Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my mother and she will help me think of answers and solutions together.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Talking openly with your teen about body changes and relationships helps them feel safe, supported, and better able to make healthy choices. 

No matter your teen’s age, now is the best time to build trust and guide them with care.
rows.media_title: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name learned a lot from honest talks with her mother. Tap play to hear their story
rows.media_transcript:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. I thought all those things were true, and I was doing a lot of things secretly, because my friends were pushing me and I was afraid of what my mother would say.

When I did this app together with my mother, I realised that so many things I learnt were not true. I learnt I can get better information and I learnt others should never push me to do things I do not want to do. My mother and I can talk about these things now. I wish we could have done that when I was younger, because it would have helped me a lot, but I am still glad we can talk today. Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my mother and she will help me think of answers and solutions together.
